messages.content: HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I have a persistent cough and shortness of breath. Could it be heart disease?

A persistent cough and shortness of breath can be symptoms of various conditions, including heart disease. However, I'm not a doctor, and you should consult a healthcare professional for a proper evaluation.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I experience chest pain. Is it possible that I have lung cancer?
Chest pain can have multiple causes, one of which is lung cancer. But remember, I'm not a substitute for professional medical advice. You should consult a doctor to address your concerns.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I've noticed blood in my stool. Could it be colon cancer?
Blood in the stool can be a sign of various conditions, including colon cancer. It's crucial to seek advice from a healthcare expert to assess your symptoms.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I've been feeling fatigued and dizzy. Is this related to heart disease?
Fatigue and dizziness can be linked to heart disease, but they can also have other causes. It's essential to have a comprehensive evaluation by a healthcare professional.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
Can difficulty swallowing be a symptom of lung cancer?
Difficulty swallowing is not a common symptom of lung cancer, but it's wise to consult a healthcare provider to determine the underlying cause.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I've had unexplained weight loss. Is colon cancer a possibility?
Unexplained weight loss can be associated with various health issues, including colon cancer. Consult a doctor to investigate the cause.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I experience chest pain and shortness of breath. Could it be related to heart disease?
Chest pain and shortness of breath can be symptoms of heart disease. It's crucial to consult a healthcare professional for a proper assessment.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I've been coughing up blood. Is this a sign of lung cancer?
Coughing up blood can be associated with lung cancer, among other conditions. Please seek medical advice to address your symptoms.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I have abdominal pain and changes in bowel habits. Could this be colon cancer?
Abdominal pain and changes in bowel habits are potential symptoms of colon cancer, but they can also be caused by various factors. Consult a healthcare expert for guidance.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I've been experiencing irregular heartbeats. Is this related to heart disease?
Irregular heartbeats can be associated with heart disease, but they can have other causes as well. It's advisable to consult a medical professional for an accurate diagnosis.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.

Can difficulty swallowing be a symptom of lung cancer?
Difficulty swallowing is not a common symptom of lung cancer, but it's wise to consult a healthcare provider to determine the underlying cause.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I'm not sure how to access my profile. Can you help me with that?
To access your profile, click on the user icon on the top right of your screen. You will then see the ‘Profile’ option.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
Where can I find the reports section?
You can find the 'Reports' section by clicking on the 'Reports' button in the header of this page.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I want to go to the chat page. How can I get there?
To go to the chat page, simply click on the 'Chat' button in the header of this page.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
How do I log out of my account?
To log out, click on your user icon at the top right corner, and a dropdown menu will appear. From there, select 'Logout' to log out of your account.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I'm interested in the LLM page. How do I access it?
This the LLM page, so you’re in the right place!
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
Where can I edit my profile details?
To edit your profile details, go to the 'Profile' page by clicking on the 'Profile' button in the header of this page. You can then find the 'Edit' button on that page to make changes.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
How do I navigate to the 'Predict' section?
You can navigate to the 'Predict' section by clicking on the 'Predict' button in the header of this page.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I need to manage my payments. How can I do that?

To manage your payments, click on your user icon at the top right corner. A dropdown menu will appear with options like 'Profile' and 'Logout.' You can manage your payments from inside the Profile page.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
Can you help me find the 'Patients' section?
You can find the 'Patients' section by clicking on the 'Patients' button in the header of this page.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I'm looking for the 'Dashboard.' How do I get there?
To access the 'Dashboard,' click on the 'Dashboard' button in the header of this page.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I just logged into the dashboard. What does the 'Average Age' metric represent?
The 'Average Age' metric represents the average age of your patients in the system. It helps you understand the age distribution of your patient population.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
Can you explain the 'Risk Assessment' chart on the page?

Certainly! The 'Risk Assessment' chart shows the distribution of patients among different risk categories, such as 'Low Risk,' 'Medium Risk,' and 'High Risk.' It helps you assess the overall risk profile of your patients.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I see a 'Gender Distribution' chart. What does it tell me about my patients?

The 'Gender Distribution' chart provides insights into the gender distribution of your patients. It shows the number of male and female patients, helping you understand the gender balance among your patient population.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What is the significance of the 'Lifestyle Factors' chart?

The 'Lifestyle Factors' chart displays information about lifestyle-related factors of your patients, including alcohol consumption, smoking, and diet compliance. It allows you to see how these factors are distributed among your patients.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
In the 'Respiratory Symptoms' chart, what do the different symptoms represent?

The 'Respiratory Symptoms' chart represents the prevalence of respiratory symptoms among your patients. It includes symptoms like 'Coughing Blood,' 'Fatigue,' and 'Wheezing.' You can see how common these symptoms are in your patient population.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I noticed the 'Environmental Factors' chart. What environmental factors does it cover?

The 'Environmental Factors' chart covers factors like 'Air Pollution' and 'Dust Exposure' among your patients. It helps you understand the extent to which environmental factors affect your patients' health.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
Tell me more about the 'Sleep Patterns' chart. What does 'Snorer' and 'Not Snoring' mean?
The 'Sleep Patterns' chart categorizes your patients into 'Snorer' and 'Not Snoring' based on their sleep patterns. It provides insights into how many of your patients snore and how many do not.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I see a 'Diet Compliance Donut Chart.' What does it represent?

The 'Diet Compliance Donut Chart' displays the percentage of patients who are 'Adhering to Diet' and those who are 'Not Adhering to Diet.' It gives you an overview of your patients' dietary compliance.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What are the different age groups in the 'Age Distribution' chart?

The 'Age Distribution' chart divides your patients into different age groups, such as '1-10,' '11-20,' and so on. It shows the distribution of patients in each age group, helping you understand the age demographics of your patients.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
Can you explain the 'Key Metrics' section and what each metric means?

Certainly! The 'Key Metrics' section provides essential information about your patient population. It includes metrics like 'Patient Count,' 'Average Age,' and counts for various health-related factors. For example, 'Air Pollution Exposure' shows how many patients are exposed to high air pollution.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I'm on the Patients page. What kind of data is displayed here?
The Patients page displays information about patients. It includes their name, age, gender, and risk level.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
How can I search for specific patients on this page?
You can search for specific patients by using the search bar at the top of the page. Just enter the patient's name to filter the list.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What do the 'Filter' and 'Add Patient' buttons do on this page?
The 'Filter' button allows you to apply filters to narrow down the list of patients based on criteria like age, gender, and risk. The 'Add Patient' button is used to add a new patient to the system.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
How can I filter the patients on this page?

You can filter patients by clicking the 'Filter' button. This opens a filter modal where you can set filter criteria based on age, gender, and risk level. You can apply these filters to refine the patient list.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What's the purpose of the 'Age Filter' in the filter modal?
The 'Age Filter' allows you to specify how you want to filter patients by their age. You can choose options like 'Less Than,' 'Greater Than,' 'Between,' or 'Equal To' and set age values accordingly.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
Can you explain what 'Risk' means in the context of patients?

In the context of patients, 'Risk' refers to their risk level or health condition severity. Patients may have different risk levels, such as 'Low,' 'Medium,' or 'High,' indicating the seriousness of their medical condition.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
How do I clear the applied filters on the patient list?
You can clear the applied filters by clicking the 'Clear Filters' button in the filter modal. This will remove all the filters and show the full list of patients.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What happens when I click on a patient's name in the patient list?

Clicking on a patient's name in the patient list will take you to a detailed view of that specific patient's information, where you can access more data about the patient's health and medical history.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I'm on the Patient Details page. What kind of data is displayed here?
The Patient Details page displays information about a specific patient, including their name, age, gender, contact details, insurance information, and various medical and health-related data.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
How can I edit the patient's details on this page?
You can edit the patient's details by clicking the 'Edit' button. This will allow you to update information such as the patient's name, age, gender, contact details, and more.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What happens when I click the 'Save' button after making changes?
Clicking the 'Save' button will update the patient's information with the changes you made. It will save the edited data to the database, ensuring that the patient's records are up to date.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
Can you explain the numeric fields on this page, like 'air_pollution' and 'genetic_risk'?

The numeric fields represent various medical and health-related measurements or scores. For example, 'air_pollution' might indicate a patient's exposure to air pollution, and 'genetic_risk' could reflect their genetic predisposition to certain health conditions.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
How can I export the patient's details as a CSV or PDF file?

You can export the patient's details by clicking the 'Export as CSV' or 'Export as PDF' buttons. This will generate a file with the patient's information in either CSV or PDF format that you can save to your device.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What information is included in the CSV and PDF exports?

The CSV and PDF exports include various patient details, such as their name, age, gender, contact information, and the values of numeric fields. You can choose the format that suits your needs for sharing or storing the patient's data.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
How do I return to the list of all patients from this page?

To return to the list of all patients, you need to navigate back to the 'Patients' page by clicking the ‘Patients’ button in the header of this page or else clicking the back button on your browser. This page specifically displays details for a single patient.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I'm on the 'Create Patient' page. What kind of data can I input here?

On the 'Create Patient' page, you can input various patient details, including their name, date of birth, gender, contact information, insurance information, and numerous medical and health-related measurements or scores.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
How do I save a new patient's information after entering it?

You can save a new patient's information by filling in the required fields and then clicking the 'Save Patient' button at the bottom of the page. This will add the patient to the database and redirect you to the 'Patients' page.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
Can you explain the different input fields on this page, like 'radius_mean' and 'breast_tissue'?

Certainly! 'radius_mean' and other similar fields represent various medical measurements or scores. 'breast_tissue' is a choice between 'Malignant' and 'Benign.' The range-based fields allow you to input values within specific ranges, while others use a range from 0 to 8.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
How do I choose between 'Malignant' and 'Benign' for the 'breast_tissue' field?

To choose between 'Malignant' and 'Benign' for the 'breast_tissue' field, simply click on the radio button next to your choice. This field is used to indicate the type of breast tissue, with 'Malignant' typically representing cancerous tissue and 'Benign' representing non-cancerous tissue.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What do the range-based input fields represent, like 'radius_mean'?

Range-based input fields, such as 'radius_mean,' allow you to specify numeric values within a specific range. The value should be a number falling within the range indicated, and you can use the slider to select the value you desire.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
Can you explain the 'dob' field's format for entering the date of birth?

The 'dob' field expects the date of birth in the 'DD-MM-YYYY' format, where 'DD' represents the day, 'MM' represents the month, and 'YYYY' represents the year. For example, '25-12-1990' would be a valid input for December 25, 1990.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I'm on the 'Reports' page. What can I do here?

On the 'Reports' page, you can generate reports based on patient data. You can filter the data, select specific fields to include in the report, and then export the report as either a CSV or PDF file.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
How can I filter the patient data for generating reports?

To filter patient data, click the 'Filter Symptoms' button. You can select or deselect specific data fields that you want to include in the report by using checkboxes next to each field. You can also toggle between selecting all fields or deselecting them all with the 'Select/Deselect All' option.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What kind of patient data fields can I include in the report?

You can include various patient data fields in the report. By default, fields such as 'name,' 'age,' 'gender,' 'phone,' 'postcode,' 'insurance_name,' and 'insurance_number' are available. You can also choose from additional fields that may be specific to the patients' health data.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
How do I export a report as a CSV file?

To export a report as a CSV file, ensure that you've selected the desired data fields, and then click the 'Export CSV' button. This will generate a CSV file containing the selected patient data fields for download.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
Can I export a report as a PDF?

Yes, you can export a report as a PDF. Click the 'Export PDF' button after selecting the desired data fields. The generated PDF report will include the selected patient data fields, and you can download it for further use.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What is the 'age' field in the patient data, and how is it calculated?

The 'age' field represents the age of each patient. It is calculated based on the patient's date of birth (DOB). The system calculates the age from the DOB and the current date to provide the patient's age at the time the report is generated.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
Why is the 'Select/Deselect All' option used in the field selection modal?

The 'Select/Deselect All' option is used to quickly toggle between selecting all available data fields or deselecting them all. It can save time when choosing which fields to include in the report, especially if there are many available fields.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I'm on the 'LLM' page. What can I do here?

On the 'LLM' page, you can interact with the HealthAI Chatbot. You can type your questions or messages in the input field, and the chatbot will respond with answers and information. If you have an active subscription, you can use this feature. If not, you might be prompted to upgrade to a Standard subscription.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
How can I check my subscription status?
Your subscription status is automatically checked when you visit this page. It determines whether you can use the chatbot feature. You'll see messages or prompts based on your subscription status.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I see a chat interface. How do I interact with the chatbot?

To interact with the chatbot, type your questions or messages in the input field and press 'Enter' or click the 'Ask' button. The chatbot will respond with answers and information based on your input. It's a conversational way to get information.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What happens if I press 'Enter' in the chat input field?
If you press 'Enter' in the chat input field, it will trigger the chatbot to respond to your message. It's a convenient way to initiate a conversation with the chatbot.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
Why do I see 'Upgrade to Standard' on this page?

The 'Upgrade to Standard' section appears if you don't have an active subscription. To access the chatbot feature, you may need to upgrade to a Standard subscription. You can click the 'Upgrade' button to proceed with the upgrade process.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I'm on the 'Chat' page. What's the purpose of this page?

The 'Chat' page is a platform where doctors can connect and have discussions. You can send and receive messages from other doctors. It's a place for general advice and communication between fellow doctors.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I see 'Online Users' listed on the page. What does that represent?
'Online Users' shows the list of doctors who are currently active on this chat platform. You can see their names, and they are available for communication.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
How do I know if I'm logged in on this page?
If you see the chat interface, online users, and can send messages, then you are logged in. If you are not logged in, you'll see a message prompting you to log in to access your profile.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What happens when I send a message in the chat?

When you send a message, it's broadcasted to other doctors on the platform. Your message is displayed in the chat interface. You can see your own messages and the messages from other doctors in the conversation.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
How do I receive messages from other doctors on this chat?

You'll automatically receive messages from other doctors in real-time. The chat platform listens for incoming messages and displays them in the chat interface. You can see messages from other doctors and engage in discussions.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What's the purpose of the 'online-users' section on this page?
The 'online-users' section lists doctors who are currently active on the chat platform. It helps you identify other doctors who are available for communication and interaction.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I'm on the 'Home' page. What's the purpose of this page?

The 'Home' page is the landing page of the HealthAI website. Its purpose is to welcome you and provide options to either log in or sign up. If you're already authenticated, it redirects you to your profile. It serves as the entry point to the website.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I see a 'Login' button and a 'Sign Up' button. What do they do?

The 'Login' button allows you to log in to your HealthAI account if you're a registered user. It's for individuals who already have an account. The 'Sign Up' button is for new users who want to create an account. It's the first step to get started with HealthAI.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What happens if I click the 'Login' button?
Clicking the 'Login' button will redirect you to the login page, where you can enter your credentials to access your HealthAI account if you're already registered.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What happens if I click the 'Sign Up' button?
If you click the 'Sign Up' button, it will take you to the signup page, where you can create a new HealthAI account by providing the required information and credentials.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I noticed an image at the top left with the 'Logo' alt text. What's the significance of this logo?
The logo at the top left represents the HealthAI brand. It's a visual identifier of our website. It helps users recognize and associate the website with the HealthAI brand.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I'm on the 'Login' page. What's the purpose of this page?

The 'Login' page is where you can log in to your HealthAI account. If you already have an account, you can enter your email and password to access your account. If not, you can choose to sign up or reset your password.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I see an email input and a password input. What should I do with them?
You should enter your registered email address and password in the respective fields. This information is used to verify your identity and grant you access to your HealthAI account.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What happens when I click the 'Login' button?
When you click the 'Login' button, the provided email and password are verified. If they are correct, you'll be logged into your HealthAI account, and you'll be redirected to the 'Profile' page.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What should I do if I forget my password?

If you forget your password, you can click 'Forgot your password?' to open the password reset modal. There, you can enter your email, and a password reset email will be sent to you if the email is registered. You can use this email to reset your password.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I noticed buttons to sign in with Google, Twitter, and Facebook. What are these for?

These buttons allow you to log in with your Google, Twitter, or Facebook account. If you use one of these social media accounts, you can simply click one of these buttons to log in using your social media credentials.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I'm on the 'Logout' page. What's its purpose?

The 'Logout' page allows you to log out of your HealthAI account. If you're currently signed in, you'll see a 'Sign Out' button. Clicking it will log you out. If you're not signed in, you'll see a message indicating that you're not signed in.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I see a 'Welcome!' message. What does this mean?
The 'Welcome!' message is a personalized greeting. If you're signed in, it displays your email address, indicating that you're currently logged into your HealthAI account.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What happens when I click the 'Sign Out' button?
When you click the 'Sign Out' button, it will log you out of your HealthAI account. You'll be redirected to the 'Home' or 'Login' page, depending on how your application is configured.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I'm not signed in, and I see the message 'You are not signed in.' What does this mean?
The 'You are not signed in' message indicates that you're currently not logged into your HealthAI account. It's a reminder that you need to log in to access your account's features.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I'm on the 'Sign Up' page. What is its purpose?
The 'Sign Up' page allows you to create a new HealthAI account. You can sign up by providing your name, email, and a password that meets certain requirements.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I see a 'Name' field. What should I enter there?
In the 'Name' field, please enter your full name, like 'John Doe'. It helps us personalize your account.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
Tell me about the 'Email Address' field. What do I need to enter?
The 'Email Address' field requires you to enter a valid email address, like 'johndoe@gmail.com'. This email will be used to identify your account.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What are the requirements for the 'Password' field?

The 'Password' you choose should be at least 10 characters long, contain at least one capital letter, one number, and one special character (e.g., !@#$%^&*). These requirements enhance your account's security.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I see a 'Confirm Password' field. What is its purpose?

The 'Confirm Password' field is for you to re-enter the password you've chosen. It ensures that you've entered the same password without any typos. Both 'Password' and 'Confirm Password' should match.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What happens if my password doesn't meet the requirements?

If your password doesn't meet the requirements (at least 10 characters, contains one capital letter, one number, and one special character), you'll see an error message indicating what's missing. You must meet these requirements to sign up.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What if I enter different passwords in 'Password' and 'Confirm Password'?

If you enter different passwords in 'Password' and 'Confirm Password', you'll see an error message indicating that the passwords don't match. Please make sure both passwords are identical before signing up.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What is the 'Sign Up' button for?
The 'Sign Up' button is used to create your HealthAI account once you've filled in your name, email, and password correctly. Clicking it will start the sign-up process.

What if I already have an account? How do I log in?
If you already have a HealthAI account, click the 'Already have an account? Login here!' button to go to the login page.

I see a 'Password Requirements' section. What does it indicate?

The 'Password Requirements' section shows whether your entered password meets the specified requirements. Each requirement is marked with either a green checkmark (✅) if met or a red cross (❌) if not met. Ensure all requirements are met to sign up.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
I'm on the 'Additional Information' page. What's its purpose?
The 'Additional Information' page is where you can provide additional details about yourself as a healthcare professional. This information helps us tailor our services to your needs.

I see a 'Medical License Number' field. What should I enter there?
In the 'Medical License Number' field, please enter your official medical license number. This is essential for verifying your credentials.

Tell me about the 'Work Place' field. What should I enter there?
In the 'Work Place' field, provide the name or location of your current workplace. This information is useful for personalization and can help you connect with colleagues.

What are the 'Address Line 1' and 'Address Line 2' fields for?

The 'Address Line 1' and 'Address Line 2' fields are for your home address. 'Address Line 1' typically includes the street address, and 'Address Line 2' is for additional details, like apartment numbers.
HealthAI is an AI-driven symptom-checker for educational purposes only.
What about the 'Work Address Line 1' and 'Work Address Line 2' fields?

The 'Work Address Line 1' and 'Work Address Line 2' fields serve a similar purpose but are for your workplace address. Use 'Work Address Line 1' for the primary address and 'Work Address Line 2' for additional details.

What's the purpose of the 'Town,' 'City,' 'Country,' and 'Postcode' fields?
The 'Town,' 'City,' 'Country,' and 'Postcode' fields help identify your location more precisely. Enter your town, city, country, and postal code (if applicable) in these fields.

I see a 'Phone Number' field. Should I enter my mobile number or another contact number?
In the 'Phone Number' field, please enter a contact number where you can be reached. This can be your mobile number or another reliable contact number.

Do I need to fill out all these fields, or are some optional?

Some fields are required, such as 'Name,' 'Email,' 'Password,' and 'Phone Number.' Others, like 'Medical License Number' and 'Workplace,' are optional but recommended for a more personalized experience.

I've entered all my information. What happens when I click 'Next'?
When you click 'Next,' your additional information is saved, and you'll be redirected to the next relevant page in the registration process.

I see a 'Reset Password' modal. What is its purpose?
The 'Reset Password' modal allows you to reset your password. If you've forgotten your password, you can use this to receive a password reset email.

There's an 'Enter your email' input field. What should I enter there?
In the 'Enter your email' field, please provide the email address associated with your account. You'll receive a password reset email at this address.

I've entered my email. What happens when I click 'Reset Password'? How does it work?

When you click 'Reset Password,' a request is sent to reset your password. You'll receive an email with instructions to reset your password. Follow those instructions to set a new password for your account.

What should I do if I've changed my mind and don't want to reset my password?
If you've changed your mind, you can click 'Cancel' to close the modal without resetting your password.

I've clicked 'Reset Password,' but nothing happened. What should I do?

If clicking 'Reset Password' doesn't seem to work, please ensure you've entered a valid email address and that you have an active internet connection. If the issue persists, contact our support team for assistance.

I see a 'PricingPage.' What is this page for?
The 'PricingPage' displays pricing information and likely allows users to select and purchase subscription plans.

What happens when I interact with this page? How do I select and purchase subscription plans?
Interacting with this page may allow you to view different subscription plans and select one. Payments are handled by Stripe so you will be redirected to their side to complete the payment.

Is there a way to cancel or change my subscription after purchasing one?
The ability to cancel or change your subscription can be found inside the ‘Profile’ section of your account.
